result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Micah E Glenn in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Micah E Glenn.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Westphal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are advised that this case will be re-assigned to Br. 11 Judge Swanson due to the defendants lower pending matter 22CF2550. Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in PE.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Motion to Withdraw, Attorney Matthew Plummer

Defendant Micah E Glenn appeared by video. Attorney Matthew Plummer appeared by video for Micah E Glenn. Attorney Matthew Wessler appeared on behalf of Nicolas J Heitman in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel is newly appointed and requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 08-28-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/26/22 @ 2:30p
